page.description: Perform a streamed copy to a string- control variables include .exit and .bytes .
page.syntax: String as C = Stream_To_String(P stream_from,P control[,N chunksize[,N max_length]])

argument.name: stream_from
argument.description: A file pointer or socket pointer.

item.name: pControl.bytes
item.description: a running count of how many bytes have been streamed so far. It does not matter what you set this to, it gets reset to 0 at the beginning of the stream operation and it automatically updated as the stream progresses. This can be used to implement a progress bar.

item.name: pControl.exit
item.description: A logical flag. If it is set to .t., the stream operation will abort. This can be used to implement a cancel button

argument.name: chunksize
argument.description: Optional. Indicates the size of the chunks in which the stream is transferred.

argument.name: max_length
argument.description: Optional. Indicates the maximum bytes that should be streamed. The operation will stop if it reaches this size, even if there is more data available.

page.discussion: Streaming is a faster, optimized way of copying. The FILE.STREAM_TO_STRING() method copies data from a file or socket to a character variable.
